results.content: It is sometimes difficult to understand the accent, but I really enjoyed the rapid, to-the-point pace.  There are many libraries used and this course doesn't really tell you what they are doing exactly, so this isn't for a novice.  I'm now going to have to back-track and figure out what each of these components is​ actually doing, but it is a good introduction and feeder course onto these libraries.

results.content: Great course! Super Fast but you learn a lot and all code is downloadable and works!!!... Be aware. Due to the speed of the course and the advanced subject of the course it is not for beginning Nodejs developers.

results.content: Good course, breezed through a lot of it and gives a good basic understanding, if it was a bit more in depth and a little slower, i would give it a 5
results.content_html: Good course, breezed through a lot of it and gives a good basic understanding, if it was a bit more in depth and a little slower, i would give it a 5

results.content: The course was helpful, the instructor seems to know a lot about the topic, it helped me get a solid foundation with jwt, with the way the course is outlined it seems like you will be building an application involving jwt and passport local strategy , but  that's not the case. There's a lot of copy and paste, and it moves very quickly, with almost no explanation of code.
results.content_html: The course was helpful, the instructor seems to know a lot about the topic, it helped me get a solid foundation with jwt, with the way the course is outlined it seems like you will be building an application involving jwt and passport local strategy , but that's not the case. There's a lot of copy and paste, and it moves very quickly, with almost no explanation of code.

results.content:
Oddly the first tutorial was lifted from a Scotch.io written tutorial but I had some problems with that tutorial before and it was helpful to have someone talk it through.

I found the course to be helpful and fast.

I would have loved a more in depth JWT explanation with the use of cookies or sessions so I could see how to use it in a real world scenario but it was helpful none the less.

response.content: Thank you very much for your review! I am glad it was helpful for you!
response.content_html: Thank you very much for your review! I am glad it was helpful for you!

results.content:
As others have stated, the instructor went very fast. No way to learn much if I have to keep pausing every 30 seconds to follow along in the included source files. 

I did learn a bit (wish he went more in-depth in JWT client and server side code/api )

results.content: This is very much a beginner course and not something for someone simply trying to flesh out their understanding of passport. If you know node, middleware, and have built numerous authentication flows in the past, and simply want to better understand Passport, this course is probably not for you.
results.content_html: This is very much a beginner course and not something for someone simply trying to flesh out their understanding of passport. If you know node, middleware, and have built numerous authentication flows in the past, and simply want to better understand Passport, this course is probably not for you.

results.content: Course is very good and I loved it. Only thing is it is very fast and need to pause the lecture now and then to follow

results.content:
The speed is not appropriate for a beginner student (to the topic).  I am using the .75 speed to code along to understand what the experience of users coding with the video might be.

He also introduces terms without defining them.   What are "claims" for example?  No full definition is necessary if it's premature to talk about but a general explanation is appropriate to set context for learners.
results.content_html:

results.content: I was looking for a tutorial on how to use JSON web token to authenticate socail media accounts. This is 2 separate startegies. Its JSON web token, the a completely different app with passport that uses session based authentication. Its silly because the prvewi goes over how much better JWTs are but then deotes half the course to session based auth with passport so i didnt find it useful at all.
